msContents.summary: A volume containing fifteen separate documents, mostly orders (ḥukmnāmah) and consultations of Ṭīpū Sulṭān. Several are in Ṭīpū’s hand, and almost every one contains annotations by Col. William Kirkpatrick into whose hands they passed after the fall of Śrīraṅgapaṭṭaṇa (India) in 1799. The documents comprise:

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on U. Sims-Williams: Handlist of Islamic manuscripts acquired by the India Office Library 1938-85. London, 1986

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact British Library, Registering for a Reader Pass). Contact apac-enquiries@bl.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript

طيپو سلطان، فتح على، نواب ميسور

msItem.title: Consultations
msItem.note: Consultations, partly in his own hand, of Ṭīpū Sulṭān of Mysore with his ministers on Babr Jang’s jāgīr, the return of his two sons taken hostages, a proposed tour, the Mahdavis, and Shūndījī Vāgh

listBibl.bibl: For a more detailed description see Sims-Williams 1986, page 5-6.

لوازم گروۀ جات کامگاری قلعۀ دار السلطنت پنن
msItem.note: Statements of labourers and workmen employed on the fortifications of Seringapatam

listBibl.bibl: For a more detailed description see Sims-Williams 1986, page 6.

اقرارنامه

Contains the seal of Ṭīpū Sulṭān, dated 1223
Copyst Muḥammad Ḥabīb Allāh, محمدحبيب الله
